q: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
h:
“Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
h:
“Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
h:
“Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak. Courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.” —
Winston Churchill

q: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.
h:
“You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
h:
“Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.” —
Sydney Smith

q: Courage is fear that has said its prayers and decided to go forward anyway.
h:
“Courage is fear that has said its prayers and decided to go forward anyway.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
h:
“Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.” —
Mark Twain

q: Courage Is a Love Affair with the Unknown
h:
“Courage Is a Love Affair with the Unknown” —
Osho

q: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
h:
“I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.
h:
“He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: Life is not meant to be easy my child, but take courage: it can be delightful.
h:
“Life is not meant to be easy my child, but take courage: it can be delightful.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
h:
“Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage. ” —
Lao Tzu

q: Giving is the secret of a healthy life. Not necessarily money, but whatever a person has of encouragement, sympathy and understanding.
h:
“Giving is the secret of a healthy life. Not necessarily money, but whatever a person has of encouragement, sympathy and understanding.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
h:
“You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.” —
James Allen

q: Honor is the foundation of courage.
h:
“Honor is the foundation of courage.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.
h:
“Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of a readiness to die.
h:
“Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of a readiness to die.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
h:
“All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.” —
Walt Disney

q: All happiness depends on courage and work.
h:
“All happiness depends on courage and work.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.
h:
“A man with outward courage dares to die: a man with inner courage dares to live.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
h:
“Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
h:
“You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.” —
William Faulkner

q: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
h:
“The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.” —
Robert Greene

q: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
h:
“What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything? ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
h:
“The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.” —
Coco Chanel

q: To be heroic is to be courageous enough to die for something; to be inspirational is to be crazy enough to live a little.
h:
“To be heroic is to be courageous enough to die for something; to be inspirational is to be crazy enough to live a little.” —
Criss Jami

q: Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.
h:
“Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.” —
Alfred Adler

q: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.
h:
“The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
h:
“Courage is knowing what not to fear.” —
Plato

q: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
h:
“You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
h:
“Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: You can never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
h:
“You can never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: Courage is found in unlikely places.
h:
“Courage is found in unlikely places.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it.
h:
“The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Fear is what stops you. Courage is what keeps you going.
h:
“Fear is what stops you. Courage is what keeps you going.” —
Unknown

q: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
h:
“All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
h:
“Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.” —
John Wooden

q: Talent is luck. The important thing in life is courage.
h:
“Talent is luck. The important thing in life is courage.” —
Woody Allen

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” —
Winston Churchill

q: You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
h:
“You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.” —
Oprah Winfrey
